other_tests.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears diffusely echogenic. Smooth contour of the liver with no focal liver mass. Main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. No ascites. There is a 2.5 cm shadowing stone within the lumen of the gallbladder; gallbladder is distended but otherwise unremarkable without pericholecystic fluid or wall thickening. Pancreas is not well visualized due to bowel gas. Normal echogenicity of the spleen. Normal measurements and echogenicity of the kidneys with no evidence of masses, stones, or hydronephrosis. Visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal limits.
